Metadata.Label: Lung-RADS Cancer Screening

References.Citation: Kazerooni EA, Austin J, Black WC, Dyer DS, Hazelton T, Leung AN, McNitt-Gray MF, Munden RF, Pipavath S. ACR-STR Practice Parameter for the Performance and Reporting of Lung Cancer Screening Thoracic Computed Tomography (Resolution 4). Journal of Thoracic Imaging 2014;29(5):310-316

Diagram.Label: ACR Lung Imaging Reporting and Data System (Lung-RADS) Assessment Categories

Contact.Name: Tarik Alkasab, MD, PhD
Contact.Institution: Massachusetts General Hospital, Harvard Medical School

Metadata.ReportCitationText: Lung cancer screening categorization and recommendations per American College of Radiology Lung-RADS Version 1.0 (http://www.acr.org/Quality-Safety/Resources/LungRADS).

Choice.Label: 0: Prior CT being located
Choice.Hint: Prior chest CT examin ation(s) being located for comparison

Choice.Label: 0: Lungs cannot be evaluated
Choice.Hint: Part or all of lungs cannot be evaluated

Choice.Label: 1: Nodule(s) with specific calc
Choice.Hint: Nodule(s) with specific calcifications: complete, central, popcorn, concentric rings and fat-containing nodules

Choice.Label: 2: Part-sol <6mm
Choice.Hint: Part solid nodule(s): <6 mm total diameter on baseline screening

Choice.Label: 2: GGN <20mm / >=20mm slow grow
Choice.Hint: Non-solid nodul(s) (GGN): <20 mm OR >=20 mm and unchanged or slowly growing

Choice.Label: 2: Cat 3/4 stable >=3 mos
Choice.Hint: Category 3 or 4 nodules unchanged for >= 3 months

Choice.Label: 3: Sol >=6-<8mm / new 4-<6mm
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s): >=6 to <8 mm at baseline OR new 4 mm to < 6 mm

Choice.Label: 3: Part-sol w sol <6mm / new <6mm
Choice.Hint: Part solid nodule(s): >6 mm total diameter with solid component <6 mm OR new <6 mm total diameter

Choice.Label: 3: GGN >=20mm baseline or new
Choice.Hint: Non-solid nodule(s) (GGN) >=20 mm on baseline CT or new

Choice.Label: 4A: Sol >=8-<15mm / growing <8mm / new 6-<8mm
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s): >=8 to <15 mm at baseline OR growing <8 mm OR new 6 to <8 mm

Choice.Label: 4A: Part-sol w sol >=6-<8mm / <4mm new/grow
Choice.Hint: Part-solid Nodule(s): >=6 mm with solid component >=6 mm to <8 mm OR with a new or growing <4 mm solid component

Choice.Label: 4B: Sol >=15 mm / new or growing >=8mm
Choice.Hint: Solid nodule(s): >= 15 mm OR new or growing, and >= 8 mm

Choice.Label: 4B: Part-sol w sol >=8mm / new or growing sol >=4mm
Choice.Hint: Part-solid Nodule(s) with: a solid component >= 8 mm OR a new or growing >= 4 mm solid component

Choice.Label: 4X: Cat 3/4 w susp features
Choice.Hint: Category 3 or 4 nodules with additional features or imaging findings that increases the suspicion of malignancy

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Additional finding?
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Clinically significant or potentially significant finding?

Branch.TextExpression: There is a potentially significant incidental finding.

ChoiceDataElement.Label: Hx Lung Cancer?
ChoiceDataElement.Hint: Does the patient have a prior diagnosis of lung cancer?

Branch.TextExpression: There is a prior history of lung cancer.

Branch.Label: 4B: Part-sol w sol >=8mm / new or growing sol >=4mm

EndPoints.TemplatePartial: Additional lung cancer screening CT images and/or comparison to prior chest CT examination.
Continue annual screening with low-dose chest CT in 12 months.
Follow up low-dose chest CT in 6 months.
Follow-up low dose chest CT in 3 months or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.
Tissue sampling, chest CT with or without contrast, or (for nodules with solid component 8 mm or larger) PET/CT.

ReportTexts.ReportText: Lung-RADS Category: . The prior chest CT examination is being located for comparison.
Comparison to prior chest CT examination.

Lung-RADS Category: . The prior chest CT examination is being located for comparison.
Recommendation: Comparison to prior chest CT examination.
Lung-RADS Category: . Part or all of the lungs cannot be evaluated.
Additional lung cancer screening CT images.

Lung-RADS Category: . Part or all of the lungs cannot be evaluated.
Recommendation: Additional lung cancer screening CT images.
Lung-RADS Category: . Negative study as there are no nodules present. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.

Lung-RADS Category: . Negative study as there are no nodules present. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . Negative study as the identified . The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.

Lung-RADS Category: . Negative study as the identified . The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size and/or lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.

Lung-RADS Category: . The solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size and/or lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The partly-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Follow up low dose Chest CT in 12 months is recommended.

Lung-RADS Category: . The partly-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The non-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size or lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.

Lung-RADS Category: . The non-solid nodule has a very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to size or lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:

Lung-RADS Category: . In view of the stability of findings for 3 months, the nodule has reverted to category 2 with very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.

Lung-RADS Category: . In view of the stability of findings for 3 months, the nodule has reverted to category 2 with very low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer, due to lack of growth. The probability of malignancy is less than 1%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.

Lung-RADS Category: . The solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The partly solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.

Lung-RADS Category: . The partly solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.
Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The non-solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.

Lung-RADS Category: . The non-solid nodule is probably benign, with a low likelihood of becoming a clinically active cancer. The probability of malignancy is 1-2%.

Recommendation:
Lung-RADS Category: . The nodule demonstrates additional features or imaging findings that increase the suspicion for malignancy (probability greater than 15%).
